intro: Quekettia australis, commonly known as the Australian starflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Quekettia australis is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
